info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 5:24PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Otero County through 600 PM MDT... At 523 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cloudcroft, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cloudcroft, Burro Flats, High Rolls, Mountain Park, James Canyon, Cox Canyon, Dry Canyon and Karr Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
